title: JAMES
author: Percival Everett
description: A reimagining of “Adventures of Huckleberry Finn” shines a different light on Mark Twain's classic, revealing new facets of the character of Jim.

title: WIND AND TRUTH
author: Brandon Sanderson
description: The fifth book in the Stormlight Archive series. The fate of the Cosmere is imperiled as the fighting and chaos reach an apex.

title: WICKED
author: Gregory Maguire
description: A misunderstood girl named Elphaba is declared a witch; the basis of the musical and the film.

title: THE WOMEN
author: Kristin Hannah
description: In 1965, a nursing student follows her brother to serve during the Vietnam War and returns to a divided America.

title: FOURTH WING
author: Rebecca Yarros
description: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.

title: MELANIA
author: Melania Trump
description: The former and future first lady describes her work as a fashion model, marriage to Donald Trump and time in the White House.

title: THE BACKYARD BIRD CHRONICLES
author: Amy Tan
description: Essays and drawings by the author of “The Joy Luck Club” and “The Bonesetter's Daughter,” which depict a search for peace through birding.

title: CHER: THE MEMOIR, PART ONE
author: Cher
description: In the first part of her memoir, the multiple award-winning pop culture icon traces her childhood and forays into the world of entertainment.

title: BE READY WHEN THE LUCK HAPPENS
author: Ina Garten
description: A memoir by the cookbook author and Food Network host known as the Barefoot Contessa.

title: FRAMED
author: John Grisham and Jim McCloskey
description: Our criminal justice system viewed through the struggles of 10 wrongfully convicted people to achieve exoneration.

title: GOOD LOOKIN' COOKIN'
author: Dolly Parton and Rachel Parton George with Maurice Miner

title: THE COMPLETE COOKBOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: Over 100 kid-tested recipes from America's Test Kitchen. (Ages 8 and up)

title: IMPOSSIBLE CREATURES
author: Katherine Rundell. Illustrated Ashley Mackenzie
description: A young boy is enlisted to save a place where magical creatures reside. (Ages 10 and up)

title: THE COMPLETE BAKING BOOK FOR YOUNG CHEFS
author: America's Test Kitchen Kids
description: One hundred plus kid-tested baking recipes. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE MILLICENT QUIBB SCHOOL OF ETIQUETTE FOR YOUNG LADIES OF MAD SCIENCE
author: Kate McKinnon
description: Three sisters attend an unusual etiquette school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE BLETCHLEY RIDDLE
author: Ruta Sepetys and Steve Sheinkin
description: The siblings Jakob and Lizzie decode wartime secrets during World War II-era London. (Ages 10 and up)

title: DON'T LET THE PIGEON DRIVE THE SLEIGH!
author: Mo Willems
description: The pigeon has his sights set on driving Santa's sleigh. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: CHRISTMAS AT HOGWARTS
author: J.K. Rowling. Illustrated Ziyi Gao
description: Harry Potter celebrates his first Christmas at Hogwarts. (Ages 6 and up)

title: TAYLOR SWIFT
author: Wendy Loggia. Illustrated Elisa Chavarri
description: A biography of the pop star. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: HOW TO CATCH AN ELF
author: Adam Wallace. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: A tiny narrator dodges traps while making the Christmas rounds. (Ages 3 to 6)

title: HOW TO CATCH A GINGERBREAD MAN
author: Adam Wallace. Illustrated Andy Elkerton
description: The gingerbread man gets loose in a bookstore! (Ages 4 to 7)

title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
author: written and illustrated Jeff Kinney
description: The travails and challenges of adolescence. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: THE WILD ROBOT
author: Peter Brown
description: Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: PERCY JACKSON & THE OLYMPIANS
author: Rick Riordan
description: A boy battles mythological monsters. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: WHO WAS/IS . . . ?
author: Jim Gigliotti and others; various illustrators
description: Biographies unlock legendary lives. (Ages 8 to 11)

title: IF HE HAD BEEN WITH ME
author: Laura Nowlin
description: The coming-of-age love story of Autumn and Phineas. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: NOTHING LIKE THE MOVIES
author: Lynn Painter
description: In this sequel to "Better Than the Movies," Wes tries to win back the heart of Liz. (Ages 14 and up)

title: A STUDY IN DROWNING
author: Ava Reid
description: Dark forces try to thwart Preston and Effy's efforts to unravel the mysteries of author Emrys Myrddin's Hiraeth Manor. (Ages 14 and up)

title: MURTAGH
author: Christopher Paolini
description: Murtagh and his dragon, Thorn, must find and outwit a mysterious witch. (Ages 12 to 15)

title: THE GLASS GIRL
author: Kathleen Glasgow
description: A teenager named Bella journeys through alcoholism and recovery. (Ages 14 to 18)
